item.title: Now Close the Windows
item.description: Now Close the Windows by Robert Frost(1874-1963) Now close the windows and hush all the fields; If the trees must, let them silently toss; No bird is singing now, and if there is, Be it my loss. It will be long ere the marshes resume, It will be long ere the earliest bird: So close the windows and not hear the wind, But see all wind-stirred. ğŸ‘‰ã€Šæ²¡æœ‰é¸Ÿé¸£ï¼Œå…³ä¸Šçª—å§ã€‹byå£°éŸ³ç¢ç‰‡
